We will introduce you to the healthcare policies of the UK and the role of health and social care workers in helping people live as independently as possible. You will learn what equality and diversity mean in healthcare and how to manage poor practices and deliver quality healthcare.

courseDescription:
People use health and social care services throughout their lives. The healthcare sector is one of the largest industries in the world. It requires professionals who can effectively manage all the basic to complex activities in hospitals, clinics, or other similar facilities. As our population ages and medical advancements continue to improve life expectancy, the need for healthcare professionals and facilities becomes increasingly vital. If you want to be a part of the healthcare sector, then this course is for you. We will introduce you to the many aspects of health and social care operations, the laws, ethics and policies of the healthcare system of the UK and other countries.

First, we will give you an overview of the structure of the health and social care sectors in the UK and other countries and the difference in their operations. You will learn about the Health and Social Care Act 2012, its objectives and how the Department of Health and Social Care in the UK aims to achieve these objectives. We will introduce you to the different care services provided by health and social care workers at different stages of life, including the different types of care settings. You will learn about the challenges faced by people in accessing health and social care and the inequalities in healthcare services. We'll illustrate the importance of equality and diversity in care services with real-life examples, apprise you of the rights of patients, service users, hospital staff, and social care workers, and teach you how to identify poor practices in adult and children's services.

Quality control is an essential part of any business operation. You will explore the business management and quality improvement process within healthcare organisations. We'll show you how to handle witnessed malpractice or uncomfortable treatment situations with medication or equipment. Finally, you will learn how to improve the quality of care service in four easy steps and examine management's role in handling workplace errors, accidents, and patient and staff complaints. If you’re considering a career in the healthcare sector, this course will help you gain knowledge of public health, health promotion, health and social care management and health inequalities. If you are a patient or consumer you will have a better understanding of the administration of healthcare organisations and operations. So, why wait? Enrol today and learn for free!
